content:
Great, here's the revised letter with your additional concern:

Hello Alex,

I hope you’re having a good morning and that this email finds you well.

I wanted to reach out to you with an update regarding the property. Firstly, I would like to express my gratitude towards the landlord for repairing the dishwasher. The landlord came to take a look at the dishwasher on Monday and successfully repaired it. I had meant to send a thank you email sooner but have been very unwell.

However, I do have some other concerns that I would like to bring to your attention. Recently, I found a rusty metal spike sticking out of the ground where the back gate is to be replaced. Venkatesh had informed me that there was construction debris back there but he never mentioned that there were hazards coming out of the ground. I only found this hard spike after hearing an awful shriek from my dog who I can only assume stepped on it as there are no other hazards back there and she was passing by that gate site. I only ever saw the metal posts used for construction laid flat on the ground near the gate site and thought the construction mess was limited to those as I had not been warned about dangerous protrusions from the gravel or ground, the spike had been present for months without being noticed.

Additionally, I would like to mention that this happened while my dog was in the backyard while Venkatesh was seeing to the dishwasher. She is usually not outside unattended, but I had no reason to believe that there was a dangerous hazard in the area.

Thank you for your attention to these matters, and I look forward to hearing from you soon.

Best regards, [Your Name]
